page.title: 02A CHILDS VIEW OF DUNLOP
page.content: DUNLOP IS A SMALL VILLAGE IN AYRSHIRE WHICH IS A QUIET PLACE. THERE ARE A FEW ORGANISATIONS LIKE BROWNIES, CUBS GYMNASTICS AND YOUTH CLUBS. THERE IS A LOCAL NEWSAGENTS THAT CLOSES IN THE AFTERNOON BUT OPENS AFTER 3.00 AND STAYS OPEN UNTIL 8.30 PM. THERE ARE TWO PARKS (THE WEE SWING PARK AND THE MAIN PARK). WHEN YOU ARE OLDER YOU CAN GO TO THE YOUNG FARMERS CLUB. WHEN YOU BECOME 26 YOU CAN JOIN THE RURAL. WHEN YOU LEAVE THE PRIMARY YOU HAVE TO TRAVEL TO STEWARTON FOR YOUR SCHOOLING. THERE IS A NEW SCHOOL OPENED IN STEWARTON, STEWARTON ACADEMY.IN DUNLOP THERE IS A CHURCH AND BIBLE CLASS. THERE ARE LOVELY PLACES TO WALK, LIKE THE "WEE GLEN"AND "WOODSIDE" AND I THINK DUNLOP IS A NICE FRIENDLY VILLAGE AND WILL STILL BE HERE IN 100 YEARS TIME.
